Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: Darlene H
Reviews.Content: We went to Airtel because it was the host hotel for the car show we were attending. Typically, the host hotel for a car show is ok, but not this nice. We strode in wearing our tees and shorts, which was really apparent not the standard attire at this hotel. So I fully expected to be treated by the staff according to our attire. I could not have been more wrong. The front desk person that checked me in was my favorite type of professional - polite, but not stuffy at all. He laughed, joked and smiled, ma'amed when it fit naturally, but up with my stupid questions. His co-worker joined in and there seemed to be a nice camaraderie. The calls to address the little issues during our stay were addressed immediately and a follow up call was made to make sure everything was now resolved. There is secure parking, which was terrific for our situation. The breakfast buffet was the only meal we had, it was very well maintained by staff. There was not a lot of variety, but was offered was really simple, but quite good. I did not miss the array of things typically offered at these things that most do not want to eat. The proximity to the airport may be an issue for some, the airport is in the hotel's back yard. But we were not bothered by it. I am looking for excuses to stay here again. This place is a class act.

Reviews.Title: “I was happy until......”
Reviews.Author: L J
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire, due to the fact that it was the closest to family I was visiting who are located in the Van Nuys area. I enjoyed my stay there the first two nights. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Originally, I had only booked two nights, not knowing my stay would be extended an additional two more days. When I went to the front desk to pay for the additional days, I was told by the "acting front desk manager" that since I booked the room through a third party (Hotwire), that I would have to go back on the internet and re-book the additional days. I just stood there dumb-founded. First of all, I was already in the room as a guest and second of all, they had my card information already on file and I was paying cash for the extended stay! WHY, did I have to book the additional nights on the internet (which by the way I did not have a lap-top on me) and I was standing there with cash in my hands?!!! I would have understood if I had just walked off the streets requesting a room and the hotel was INTIRELY BOOKED, but this was not the case. If anyone from managment is reading this Brian Dunn should NOT be interacting with ANY of your customers!! His customers service skills are HORRIBLE!! As I stood there in a panick not knowing where I was going to stay, another front desk reservationist by the name of Robert helped me to secure my room. I asked him if this could have been done in the begining, what was all the extra bulls#@t for? Robert was very helpful and apologized for any inconvience. I told him I would not refer anyone I knew to that hotel and everyone I knew would hear about my bad experience while there. I did ask for the number to corporate and was directed to the hotel manager Kim Cartaino. She did phone me back but did not offer any managerial solutions that would have made me feel better about the entire experience. I am STILL researching how to contact corporate as the information is not made easily available on their website. I am going to make a valid complaint with the head honchos! Does this hotel treat all of their customers like this and no one is complaining? I paid ALOT of money to stay at this hotel for the four days I was there and this isn't even a 5-star hotel!! I could have taken my money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you're a pilot.”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: On the runway at VNY. You can't get any closer than that. Shuttle service to alll the FBO's on the field. About a 30 minute drive from LAX with no traffic. Rooms very clean and quiet. Pool looked nice The surprise was the restaurant, it was very good! Great staff, helpfull and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Van Nuys!”
Reviews.Author: Mavis2k10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Airtel Plaza Hotel for a week when I was visiting friends who live in Van Nuys. The hotel was clean, roomy and comfortable, and the food in the dining room was excellent! The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. The pool was very nice too -- large and with plenty of umbrella tables and lounge chairs. I really had a great time here! The only drawbacks were the fact that there is nothing of real interest within walking distance, and you have to pay $10/night for parking, which seems excessive, since the parking isn't really secure. However, with a room rate of approx. $125/night, it's still a good deal overall. If you do have access to a car, the bus/metro station is within a short driving distance. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to someone looking to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IVE EVER STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: sfromd
Reviews.Content: without a doubt one of the best hotels I have ever sayed at. Great location, great restaurant, great bar, great customer service and hospitality. Excellent rooms, clean and comfortable beds. I cant say enough about this hotel. It is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints At All”
Reviews.Author: Qbrick
Reviews.Content: Gotta say that I was pleasantly surprised by everything at the Airtel--the room was spacious and modern (love the shower!) and the staff was friendly and very helpful. I even decided to eat most of my meals in the hotel restaurant because their prices were reasonable, the food well prepared and the wait staff really nice people. When I decided to chill out later in the bar, the experience was much the same--plus they had one of my favorites on tap, ShockTop Wheat Beer (yummy). Usually, I wouldn't have stayed in Van Nuys but my two-day conference was only blocks away so the whole experience was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not competitive”
Reviews.Author: Margaret822
Reviews.Content: The parking fee came as a rather unpleasant surprise. Street parking was possible, but if you are not from LA and don't know what kind of neighborhood you're in, you couldn't be sure that your car would be safe overnight. Pool was a nice size, but was not heated enough. (Guess that comes hand in hand. Most smaller pools are easier/cheaper to heat up.) Blow-dryer in room didn't work; something was stuck in it. We found some hairs in the beds- I think that is our main complaint.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service, real hospitality”
Reviews.Author: diana b
Reviews.Content: All personnel were welcoming, friendly, and professional. Food service is excellent from the full breakfast, dinner, and our association's banquet. Room was very clean, shower good with lots of hot water. We rarely heard the aircraft nearby......this facility is one of the best we have seen for the value. Prompt shuttle service to the Van Nuys airport.

Reviews.Title: “The "Best in Van Nuys"...? Well.............”
Reviews.Author: Djinnphiz
Reviews.Content: If you are an aviation fanatic and don't mind being on the edge of Van Nuys airport – with the attendant over-flight of some quite noisy planes and helicopters, then this place is not "too bad". (NOT that there is an amazing amount of alternative choices available locally...) Patently, there is an "old" part and a "new part" to this establishment – and whilst the new part is as neutral and sterile as any similar hotel of this class, the older part is definitely in severe need of a "freshening". The staff are OK - mostly. In general, they were both helpful and welcoming: then again I had a couple if contacts that lacked both warmth, welcome and empathy. Perhaps I'm overly critical. Everyone is entitled to an "off" day... EXCEPT in the hospitality industry. I guess that – as a Manager – you get what you pay for, and for sure there was no-one overtly and obviously destined to greater things within the possibilities of some other better class of (internationally-reaching) establishment. The bar-fare is typically carbo-heavy USA-style. With a touch of Mexican influence. The service here was proficient if not other than neutral in character. Which – again – is OK. One doesn't always want one's Barman to be one's "best friend" either... The buffet breakfast was more-or-less correct for this kind of hotel – and it was finally good to find some fresh vegetables and even fruit. The bacon was D-licious – but the omellette majorly sucked. As with most other places of this kind that I've experienced in the US, the coffee and tea was indifferent and typically devoid of any class or style: being of the simple, passe-partout blends that reflect economic considerations and a culinary ignorance born out of commercial pragmatism. I was in the New Wing and the accommodation was equivalent to my expectations – a decent sized room, clean, efficient AC and with functional but indifferent furniture. The TV offered what it was supposed to offer as entertainment, the bathroom was as it should be and everything that I could see was as clean as one might expect: but this is not the kind of establishment where I would necessarily be overtly looking under the bed... The mattress was OK – as were the pillows. All-in-all, a very standard, and honest, room with no unpleasant surprises. There is a "kind-of" coffee shop in the entrance that offers a limited assortment of seemingly not very fresh, and obviously commercially-derived buns, cakes and other typical American stomach-stuffers. The coffee could almost have been a kind or ersatz – so very ordinary was it in taste. Not impressed either by the styrofoam cups... The swimming pool is a strange "L" shape and, unfortunately, due to it's steps at both ends – along with rounded corners – it's impossible to really do any laps, if so inclined... The surroundings are soulless, and the usual easy-maintenance but characterless, concrete, sunbathing area, was furnished with some equally banal plastic lounges, some of which were broken and needed maintenance. The only interesting detail about this hotel are some of the pictures that are displayed on the corridor walls and which depict the quite interesting pictorial devolution of the airport from its foundation days. Indeed, with the aircraft hanging from the ceiling in the entrance lobby – that provides some kind of focus of interest – the place very much rests on its laurels as an erstwhile welcomer of aeronautically-interested fans. I guess at the start of the airport in those early days, there wasn't very much choice at all for accommodation locally... It seems to have survived and modestly thrived through being a useful conference facility serving the environs. Quite who its clients are in this area I was not able to discern. But – Hey! – why not...? I wouldn't see it personally as having a particular "retreat attraction factor", but for that day-long meeting serving the needs of provincial businessmen, its facilities are more than adequate. No doubt it also serves well for local marriage, and other celebratory functions. All of which is good... I don't know what it is in the 'States - as opposed to Europe or Australasia. Maybe because – as a statistical fact – so few Americans actually have passports and travel abroad – (and so are not able to educate themselves as to other traveller's standards) – but it would seem that there are really only three categories of hotels. The VERY good – amongst which could also be classified the "boutique" establishments; the pretentiously "good" – but which are, by international standards, actually rather ordinary; and then there are the "in-and-out"-category – what I personally think-of as "service" hotels: such as the Motel Chains and the small, privately-run places along the highways – or on the outskirts of the town. This hotel would sit at the bottom end of the middle category: essentially a trifle more pretentious than it really ought to be and living off a – perhaps – once past, "local reknown". Cast aside this pretentiousness and all other things considered, therefore, I would rate this hotel as entirely "pedestrian" and of "limited merit' – its sole, and main, attractive point being that for anyone flying out of Van Nuys – for whatever reason – it is convenient. Other than that, it really is no better than most any other hotel of the same genre and only differentiates itself from a Motel-Chain quality of establishment through – precisely – its pretensions to be more than it isn't, and will never be.

Reviews.Title: “smells like my grandparents' basement”
Reviews.Author: barefeetchick
Reviews.Content: The pictures may look like it has been updated, but unfortunately, even if new furniture were added, the place hasn't actually been cleaned in I don't know how long. The room just had a serious funk to it that reminded me of the basement in my grandparents' house. For that kind of grime, it seriously overpriced. AND on top of that, guests have to pay an additional $10 per day to park in the lot, which makes the place even more exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: DawnD57
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just after I had come in at LAX. I anted somewhere to stay on my way to Lancaster. The front desk clerk was VERY nice. The hallways need some renovation in the area that I stayed, and vending machines were outside, which was a little weird. The room was clean and the bathroom immaculate. The room was large and the bed very comfortable. In the morning, I loved watching people get into a spectacular tiny jet and fly away. (They had stayed at the hotel and parked their plane just on the otherside of the parking lot. It was cool.). I would definitely stay here again. Although the parking price was annoying, but cheap considering that I live in Chicago where parking is NEVER that cheap. Having lived in So. CA before, I was surprised at a charge for parking at a hotel. Something I didn't see when I looked at their website. Maybe it's there, I just didn't see it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Ugh!stay away from "The Landing".In & Out was better.Truly horrible service and food.Needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NascarCj
Reviews.Content: This was very nice hotel for the price we got. The lobby and property were very nice and clean. The room was also very clean. The bathroom fixtures, counters and tiling sort of dated the hotel. That was fine until you get to the shower. The shower curtain looked so tattered and worn and it MAY have been clean, BUT with it's appearance, it made the bathroom look dirty!! Maybe they shouldn't use cloth curtains because it looked gross!! A nice hotel like that shouldn't be using sub-standard equipment. There wasn't a whole lot to do in the surrounding area. You have to drive a little distance for any nice areas to shop or walk around. There are no real tourist places in the immediate vicinity so be prepared to rent a car to get anywhere. The hotel personnel from the front desk to housekeeping were awesome!! Their service is exceptional and everyone was absolutely friendly and accommodating!!!! Besides my bathroom issue which I'm most picky about anyway, I really do recommend this hotel. We very much enjoyed it!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay, Never recommend”
Reviews.Author: m s
Reviews.Content: 1. Before booking this hotel, I have spoken with reservation section and inquired about free shuttle service of this hotel. A lady who answered me, informed that free shuttle service available within 2 miles to any place. When, I checked in, front desk person informed me, free shuttle available only to specific destinations. Total rip off! 2. Wifi - Terrible connection, only fast near front desk area. 3. House keeping - Don't change the soap, toiletries every day. 4. Plug point at the room is quite away from the bed, so quite difficult to connect your gadgets. 5. Only good thing about hotel is rooms are reasonably large, decently clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place - especially if you enjoy airplanes.”
Reviews.Author: fitzN
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel. Rooms large, clean and well kept. TV's do need an upgrade to flatscreens, but that's minor. Service is first rate from arrival, bell man, room service, house keepers and telephone personnel. A most quiet hotel within, however you should be aware it is on the VanNuys airport runways. While that did not bother me, in fact rather enjoyed watching private jets take off/land, etc. Probably staying on the other side of the hotel might be better for some. Room service was very good and swift. Delivery right on time. While they do charge $10 for parking your own vehicle, I can understand that fee especially when you look out your window and observe Security on the parking lot. Then in the mornings, a service worker actually sweeping the parking lot of leafs, etc. so you can understand the ten bucks are worth it to me. Staying there over the Holidays was most reasonable when you check hotels nearby. This hotel is just minutes from the 405 and the 101. You are about 15 minutes from Hollywood and about 20 minutes from Thousand Oaks. Pool very nice. Fitness center could use some attention and upgrade. Overall a very good place to stay and relax.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: ShurleyUSA
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with comfortable amenities. Love the aviation memorabilia. Breakfast was delicious with much choice. We have used this hotel twice for single female travel and felt like they were safe and secure. The front desk accommodated our wishes. This is a large, slightly upscale accommodation and many corporate pilots/crews stay here. It was like a Hilton or Courtyard. I felt it was a good price for the level of service. I hope to stay here again. Actually stayed Jan 2011, but love this hotel and wanted to write about it. With the Aviation memorabilia, it is not cookie cutter.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & service + refurbishing - Van Nuys location”
Reviews.Author: LoriBonn1
Reviews.Content: They are refurbishing & it will be delightful. Hopefully prices will not go up extremely. Rooms are large and service is very good. Lighting was weak - but should improve with room remodels. Nice pool area & 2nd jacuzzi in a separate garden area near fitness center which is actually available 24 hours. A variety of restaurants/cafes & Breakfast Package. Shuttle service was prompt - taking us a couple miles to our training site & back. I was here for business, but chatted with people who were here for vacation (including from other countries). They chose this location which was less costly than downtown LA, yet kind of "in the middle" of many options - such as The GETTY , Universal Studios, Hollywood & Hollywood Bowl The Grove & more. One evening, I drove to a nearby location & caught a no-hassle $5 round-trip Shuttle to the a concert at the Bowl. There is also a delightful Japanese Gardens - see: http://www.thejapanesegarden.com/ j-- ust a few miles away. ONE CAVEAT - I alerted the front desk to the fact that the mattresses are TOO LONG for the bed frame & I sat at the bottom end of one & fell off - luckily I was not hurt BUT it could cause someone to sprain their back or other injury. Perhaps this will be addressed in renovated rooms. EXTRAS; Refrigerators and/or microwaves are available on a limited basis -- for extra charges All in all I will consider it for business or pleasure in the LA/Van Nuys area

Reviews.Title: “Reliably good”
Reviews.Author: Dubitoff
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times now. I often travel to work nearby and usually stay at very nice places. I stayed the first time a couple of years ago because it was so close to my client. Once I was used to the area, I had planned on moving upscale and commuting to Van Nuys but the Airtel has converted me. The staff is reliably friendly and helpful. The rooms are very large and spotless. It's a touch worn but last time I was there renovations had begun and they look comprehensive. The beds are very comfortable and the food is consistently good–not anything special but better than the midrange restaurant in the high end chains. It's also got a bit of personality. From the 747model from Executive Decision hanging in the lobby to the clear affection for civil aviation, it just has something that breaks it out from the sameness of the average business hotel. I imagine the owner is a good person, the staff is too genuine for them to not enjoy working there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: toonerguy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I was leary about staying here. We were here from Sept. 16 -27 and it was wonderful. While not a 5 star, I would say its close. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job. We ate at the clipper cafe, diiner and beakfast and it was enjoyable. They are doing reno's which we didn't mind, and it sounds like it will be even better. There are two excellent employees that we met there, Jason and Jerry, who work out front and they were helpful and always stopped by to chat. Overall and very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EdwardBrentwood
Reviews.Content: Nothing is perfect. Excellent hotel and excellent price is something really unreal, but Airtel missed the highest mark just by very few issues. First, you need to pay for the parking -$10 per day. There are no fridges in the rooms and no microwave ovens. And they do not accept any pets. Now the good things - it's reasonably priced, rooms are specious and clean, the hotel restaurant serves delicious meals and they are quite cheap, and the service is very good indeed. Not a beautiful hotel, but still highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainD1234
Reviews.Content: Close to Van Nuys airport. Is't a unique place with old aviation decorations. There is a replica 747 hanging from the ceiling in the lobby. The staff is friendly and fast. Good full breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Long life”
Reviews.Author: Hussein H
Reviews.Content: Dear Team of Airtel Van Nuys, the first Night I slept in the Great USA was in your Room # 222 , so I will talk about your Wonderful hospitality whole life ,, I have never seen such a team with 24 h smiling faces :-) thank you for Team of the Magnificence Hotel . A Special thanks and gratitude to Cristina C for her Outstanding performance at The Breakfast Time and her Team . Thank you very much lovely Team of Airtel Van Nuys Good Bless you & Bless America Hussein . H was in Room # 222 in German Vielen Herzlichen Dank

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel A
Reviews.Content: i stay one nigth on mi travel to san diego las vegas in L.A anda a looko for a hotel hows have good reviewes and was in to my budget, i find here AIRTEL, and i book on line from miami, i get to L.A. in teh morning of the saturday and i call to the hotel to confirm my reserve, i ask for a spanish speaking asistent and he be more then kind and heplfully, the check in was at 3 PM but he has mi roon ready at 12:30 soo i check in early, very nice room, the hotel its kind of old but very nice manteinece, kind of a air of the PANAM time, ask for ROBERT at the front desk, very helpfully and good service. i defenetly stay there on mi next trip to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back, definitely!”
Reviews.Author: myrna a
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this hotel is not a fancy hotel much less a resort, so don't get fooled by the 5 stars, I am rating this 5 stars because of the experiences my husband and I have had with them. My husband and I had our wedding reception at this hotel back in September 2010. For a bit, we were concerned since during our wedding planning event coordinators would quit, and then we would be assigned to someone else.this happened 3 times. so that was scary, but then we were assigned to Alma Garrison. Boy we couldn't have been in better hands! Unfortunately , she also quit a few months after our wedding, but also the other event coordinators were very very professional, very helpful. Alma was by far the best though. Friendly and very professional, with amazing ideas and very understanding of the stress of planning a wedding. All the staff was pretty amazing during the planning and the day of the wedding. They even did some things for us that would have costed us money and they threw them in for free. The food is sooooo good! They did a great job in decorating, attending to our guests.they were open to following a recipe I created for a signature drink, and they served it. The banquet room was awesome. Our guests have reported that during the cocktail hour while we were taking pictures, they never ran out of appetizers and that they were very good. We got to stay in a terrace spa suite for our wedding night, wow! so pretty, huge terrace right in front of the runway. Some people may not like it though because of the noise,, but we loved it! We didn't have any problems checking in or out, and apparently no other family members had any issues. We had like 30 rooms rented and things went pretty smoothly. We have been back for dinner and lunch, and still, food is great. Hotel and rooms are older, but this hotel in the middle of Van Nuys, not such a great area, is pretty cute and has a special charm. So far, we have had good experiences with them, we have been back just to have dinner and lunch at their restaurant, Landings, and again very very good experience, food is great. We are definitely going back this month and staying there for the weekend to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Airplane Lovers”
Reviews.Author: idahosandy
Reviews.Content: Situated on the east side of the parallel runways (16L and 16R) at the famous Van Nuys airport you have a great view of the busy airport. VNY is a private aviation airport only, but the variety of business jets and propeller driven planes is terrific. I never new there were so many Gulfstream jets flying at any one time. There is a public access viewing area to the north (arrival end of runway 16) for a different perspective off of Woodley Avenue. Take your aviation frequency scanner too.

Reviews.Title: “Well worn, but they're working on it.”
Reviews.Author: Fairport_reviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is near my son's new house and will be convenient when we visit. It is well worn and in need of serious updating, but to their credit they have signs up about the renovation currently underway. I will say that the room was spacious and clean, and the showerhead was more than just the average. I appreciate that it is a non-smoking hotel, but I still saw guests smoking in the hall. Before people are scared away by a previous review, the surrounding neighborhood may be 'working class' but there's no need to be snobby or put off by it. Nice houses, friendly people. You are not in danger walking around. There is secured parking, so I don't know why someone felt their car was in danger of being stolen. The area is industrial. One complaint: we called to ask for a bathmat, which was missing. And extra towels because we had to shower so much from working on the house. They never came. We will stay here again when we visit our son, so I am looking forward to the renovation. And maybe a bathmat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Travel32655
Reviews.Content: The overall service at the hotel was very good. I had specific dietary requirements and the kitchen staff made special provisions for me throughout my stay and this was highly appreciated. The concierge (Loreto Ylagan) was very friendly and provided advice and guidance on travelling around Los Angeles. Thank you to everyone at the hotel. Rushdene

Reviews.Title: “Bad front desk service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maui721
Reviews.Content: I've booked a king-size bed room through Travelocity but when I checked-in, they said there is no king-size bed room left as booking through 3rd party would not be guaranteed. I tried to argue with them but they refused to hear and not polite at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Airtel”
Reviews.Author: SWsalesGuy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the LA area. We wanted something within a close proximity to Universal Studios. (Its about a 20 min drive). We stayed there for 2 nights and had mixed feelings about the place. Firstly, the Airtel is located in Van Nuys. For those of you not familiar, Van Nuys is a working class neighborhood and the Airtel is located next to one of the runways of the Van Nuys airport. Check in was smooth but they do charge $12 for parking. The parking lot is not secure and I did notice some broken glass in the parking lot. We stayed in the newer tower but the room was just ok. Some members of our family complained the room had a certain odor. The new tower rooms are located near their convention center/ballroom. The first evening we were there, someone was having a Quinceañera (party). The front desk did offer to move us (but Im not sure why they would put us so close since the music was quite loud to begin with). One thing that bothered me was that the entry into the hotel was NOT secured. So anyone could gain access to the hotel. The newer tower is away from the front desk so I would keep this in mind if you decide to stay here. We had breakfast in the buffet and it was typical with fruits, breads, eggs, etc. Pool was ok. I probably would be ok with the Airtel but the unlocked doors is a big concern and that's why I ranked it poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MerylRizzotti
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay. I was having my home fumigated for termites and needed a 2 night hotel. A friend recommended the Airtel. The room was clean and large. Free wifi internet. The staff was nice, attentive and accommodating. They have a nice restaurant and I highly recommend the meatball soup.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and service, loved the food and drink credit program”
Reviews.Author: brianh69
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through their website and saw they had a Food/Beverege promo which was a great deal. The credit was $25 daily and was there for 3 days and was allowed to use $75 credit throughout stay, which was helpful with our budget. On top of that the restaurant manager Javier checked on us cordially making sure we were enjoying our dining experience. My wife and I plan to return later this summer and hope they still have this promo going on then because we wanted to try everything on their menu as the food was very excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Wellcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichnRich
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Van Nuys Lax transfer bus terminal which is less than a mile from the hotel. We used the free phone to call the hotel to arrange pick up, we were amazed at how quick they came. We were greeted by JUN who was very helpful and friendly. Check in was very quick and I must say the staff could not help us enough always a smile. Our room was a standard room but well equiped with aircon tv coffee making facilities and an exellent shower, very clean and quite although on the front of the building. The pool was clean and warm and the hotel jacuzzi excellent. We had a buffet breakfast daily this also was good value, eggs bacon and a side order of sausages all in for two including juice coffe and fruit $30 great value. Also compliments to the waiters again always with a smile nothing to much trouble. We used the hotel free transportation service to and from the Balboa bus terminal both Loretto and Jun were more than helpful a credit to the hotel "Will be back" a arnien would say..

Reviews.Title: “Seriouslly, do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nomar116
Reviews.Content: We booked through a third-party and were treated as such. We got a room that stank, next to loud machinery in a closet next to our room that banged, vibrated and hummed throughout the day and night. They charge an additional $10 to park in their parking lot. The hotel is not located in a busy metropolitan area with street parking access, it is located along an alleyway at the departure end of a runway. Charging $10 to park in a completely uncovered, standard parking lot is ridiculous. The entire decor is dated, old, and dirty. They try to cover it up with pictures of vintage airplanes. While it appears the staff is trying desperately to cling to whatever rating they have left they can not make up for the properties pitfalls. AND after they stuck me with this unexpected parking fee I have no sympathy.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and kind of fun”
Reviews.Author: booklovingtraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and find it a reliable place to stay - generously sized rooms, friendly staff, etc. When there has been a hitch, it is usually quickly made good. Out of the bustle of Los Angeles, but only minutes from the freeways for quick access. The airport behind it, and the aviation mementos decorating the public areas add to a slightly different experience. Nice to see an independent hotel surviving in a niche market.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff, close to local CSUN university”
Reviews.Author: tradefloor
Reviews.Content: My takeaway from this hotel is the staff which sets it apart. They cater to every need, and were friendly indeed. Got an enormous room that had an excellent view of Van Nuys Airport private jets flying about and the surrounding mountains. A true bargain for the room price and the fantastic room service- good food. For anyone planning a trip to the Valley I thought it was a good place to stay. Was recommended by the local university nearby CSUN just a few miles from my nephew who was playing ball.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: TrikyB
Reviews.Content: Airtel is awesome! Even though it is next to a bustling airport the rooms are well insulated and the noise level is minimul. The staff member who took our reservation was friendly and professional and everything was correct upon check in. The front desk personnel went out of their way to make sure our two night stay was wonderful. The amenities included a service directory, a room service menu, phone directions, T.V. guide, and listed attractions in the surrounding area. I hesitate to extol the virtues of the hotel because I want to go back and I don't want the place to be so crowded that we can't get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, a solid choice when in the area”
Reviews.Author: shotman
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were very good but the staff service made the hotel stand out in my mind. A business associate recommended me this place since I'd never been to LA. Not knowing the area, all I had to do was ask the staff and they practically held my hand! The restaurant and bar were stellar, atmosphere and food were both high end. Had a good night's sleep even with being on a private airport. I noticed that the hotel is currently going through renovations throughout the hotel and will definitely return on next business trip and look forward to the seeing the new changes. Hotel was a bargain for a business hotel compared to what my assistant found in the Valley and have no regrets to recommend to others. If you have a car, location was less than 2 miles from Ventura Blvd with many restaurants and shops and less than a mile from San Diego Frwy. I can be contacted if any questions.

Reviews.Title: “They took great care of our group”
Reviews.Author: justacie
Reviews.Content: My husband and his colleagues from church stayed here for a conference for 1 week. They were thrilled with the accomodations, and as I was coordinating their stay there I was greatly impressed with the staff- especially with Kaishi and Mr Pease (manager). Kashi went above and beyond to make sure that the group had a comfortable experience there. She called me back promptly, even across the country to follow up and make arrangements and modifications during a week where they were very full and busy. She was pleasant and professional at all times. the Manager was responsive and avaialble. During their stay the group was excited about the hotel, and felt taken care of there. Thank you very much...all in the groupwould highly reccomend this hotel for both leisure and professional stay

Reviews.Title: “Hubby loved it. I liked it,”
Reviews.Author: luvmy79beetle
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in looked just like the picture. With the big patio, lawn funiture, jacuzzi and overlooking the airport. We watched the planes land and take off in the late afternoon. We could hear the planes from our room but usually nothing after 11:00. The decor is late 1970's to 1980's. The room and bathroom were clean and the room was spacious enough for us, So the disco theme was no big deal. It was very cold when we were there so we didn't try the jacuzzi. But I did look inside of it. It was clean and large enough for 2 people.The bathroom door also opens out to the patio next to the jacuzzi. We did have a problem with the internet not working. But it was fixed within an hour. The TV was older but the stations came in clear and they offer (expensive) lodgenet. We loved the lounge/bar very hip and busy. Lots of tables and chairs. Groups of seating areas and plenty of seating at the bar. We had room service one night and dined in the restaurant one evening. Both meals were good, although a little pricey. We had breakfast one morning. WE were not impressed with that at all. Bland and skimpy selections for $10.00!! This hotel is very close to Hollywood and Simi Valley and really all areas. I would probably stay here again if visiting the area. The hotel is not in a congested area. Easy to find and met our vavcation needs. Friendly staff too!! If I were to "wish' for" a couple things to be added/changed A mini fridge and microwave would be nice. And the parking fee of $16.00 seemed a bit much!! Happy Trails!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel - terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: flysafe068
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels for work and never write reviews. But this was the kind of place thats worthy of praise, as I have been coming here for at least 10 years and as an international traveller I stay in many levels of hotels, mostly 4-5 stars due to my employer but this hotel has them all beat. Very nice staff that goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable, all remember your names and makes you feel so welcomed that after a long international flight, you look forward to staying here, like a second home. They even cook you whatever you want, even if it is not on the menu and their food is terrific. This place is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect - good bed, bath, crew and impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: luvthegame
Reviews.Content: I wanted to look for a hotel in the Valley as I was attending the NBA Allstar Game and found this hotel through Expedia. I visit the Valley often and definitely recommend this place - everyone was friendly! Cool artwork and bits of history sprinkled throughout hotel. Oh, I forgot, the room service was excellent also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, delicious food, delightful service”
Reviews.Author: gdblessings
Reviews.Content: I was here for a church retreat for three days and am happy to report that myself and our group found the hotel just wonderful. I was in a double room and shared it with two other ladies and it was nice to have 2 real size queen beds instead of double beds. The bathroom was roomy too even with 3 of us there. Room was very clean and bed was so comfortable. My girlfriend was worried it could be noisy being next to an airport, but actually heard no noise and had a good nights sleep. Our breakfast buffet was hot and tasty. Thank you to the front desk people who were extremely gracious and full of greetings and bell staff quick to help us with our needs and bags. We are definitely staying here again next year when we return for the retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok if you have to stay there”
Reviews.Author: littlerubiez
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for a conference. The hotel is ok. The grounds are well kept. The rooms were big but out dated. There was a huge stainon my carpet. The hotel is very loud. It is on an airport. The walls are not well insulated. I could hear the TV in the room next to me and people talking in the halls all night.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburgh_AS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my first work trip to Los Angeles. The staff was very nice and the bistro in the hotel lobby was great, but the rooms were less than desirable. Everything is outdated, the carpet is stained and overall, I was not impressed at all. For my first trip to LA, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff I've experienced in all my travels, exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel4livingk
Reviews.Content: After reading other comments, I must agree with just about everyone that talked about the staff..you can really notice that they genuinely do care about your stay, from the minute you walk in to the time you say your goodbyes - everyone we passed bye consistently had the same sincere aura, a trait you rarely find anymore, even in the fancier or chain hotels. We had a great room, had all the comfort creatures we needed and was extraordinarily larger than the ones we typically stay at. We shopped around and for $129 it was definitely a bargain, as the other full service hotels nearby was about $70-$100 more and I know that they could not have topped the service. Its definitely an older hotel but kept in good shape. Even though it was not next to a fancy mall or anything, if you have a car (who doesn't if you are traveling in LA), everything is close by and they are less than a mile from the freeway. For a hotel, you must try their food - it's really good considering for a hotel. This was our second time here and will continue to stay here and recommend to our business associates and friends.

Reviews.Title: “not new but has soul”
Reviews.Author: gonebutnotdeparted
Reviews.Content: Saw some reviews saying that this is old and worn out. Hey folks, this is in Van Nuys -your choices in new places are few. I noticed that some things were old but they were well maintained. Important things were in place: very very helpful staff, restaurant, bar, room service, gift shop -they are all here. The room fair but the bed appeared to be brand new and comparable to something I would find in a 4 star. I particularly enjoyed the old aviation photographs and memorabilia that was displayed here and there. I would not take my wife here for a romantic weekend but for business it was just great. I had the feeling that if the hotel were full it would be very noisy, but this is hypothetical; there did not seem to be many patrons nearby and my stay was very quiet. bottom line, I well worth it for 130 bucks or so. Something about it has some soul, like someone actually cares that your stay is pleasant. That can go a long way with me because the attitude tends to be manifest in all the little details, whereas the corporate chain artificial attitude does not, if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: malinite
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, there were too many costs outside of the hotel rate. $10.00 per day for parking. They own their own parking lot. It is not shared. $5.00 minimum to use the business center. $50.00 hold for incidentals. On top of that, the so called "high speed internet" was extremely slow. The rooms and carpets needs to be refreshed to a more modern decor. TV in room is old and has only a few channels. Coffee they use in the rooms is generic and tasted nasty. When you get to the bottom of the cup, there is all kinds of sediment. The cheap coffee cups they use makes the coffee taste like paper. Don't expect anything extra from the General Manager. The staff at the front counter has to go through him for everything and the answer is always "no". I have stayed here a lot in the past 5 years and have seen this place get worse by the year. I stay here for the location and put up with everything for that reason. The restaurant and bar is excellent. Great service, friendly people and high quality food. A little pricy though. The staff at the from desk is extremely friendly and so are the drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Van Nuys Airport, but as noisy as you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: boatmisser
Reviews.Content: They're celebrating their 25th anniversary, but the place could pass for much older. Doesn't look well cared for and is located in a rough neighborhood. Consider your decision carefully if venturing out at night on foot. The restaurant staff seems to be aware that they have a captive audience. Desk clerks are all very nice, as are shuttle drivers. Computers in the business center can be accessed with your credit card. The workout room seems marginal--machines are creaky and most of the dumbells are missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, warm atmosphere from staff, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomtom1099
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to the Valley for a business trip or sight seeing, this is a great place to hang for a few days. The place has plenty of charm and historical tidbits throughout the lobby of hotel from the owner of the hotel who saved the originalhangar from the movie "Casablanca" to the 747 Pan Am hanging from the main lobby, which they also put a photo history on how it was transported, which answered my question when I saw the plane. When we walked in - my first impression was "wow, omg". Look for the snapshots of how they raised it up to the ceiling, the plane was in a movie too. It's an older hotel but a hidden gem in the middle of the Valley.We appreciated the free coffee they had in the lobby when we left at 5:30 am to fly home. For what its uniqueness and bargain, it was hard to beat. We glad we found this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Dmcneil127
Reviews.Content: Positives: location, large well-laid out rooms, fitness room, maid service, balcony. Negatives: very uncomfortable bed, strange odor in room, dinginess of room. It just struck me as old. Carpet dirty, furniture and drapes heavily stained, bucket in hall to catch drip from moldy air vent. Graffiti in elevator. Management needs to spring for some refurbishments. Photos on website do not match outdated rooms, and rooms too pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect place to end long holiday trip, fab time!”
Reviews.Author: luvmykids_10
Reviews.Content: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I decided to book the hotel based on the roominess, value and service people consistently commented on. We were visiting family in the area and my in-laws said to stay here too as they eat here once a week and love the place. My husband and two kids shared a room and were not disappointed at all - the rooms are spacious, a huge plus for us! The crew was amazing and gracious. This is our new favorite local place to stay next time we visit our inlaws. Thank you for a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, free shuttle to AMTRAK Station a plus”
Reviews.Author: debbhart
Reviews.Content: I was doing business in the area and picked this hotel as I noticed they had a Free Shuttle Service from the Van Nuys AMTRAK Station, which was about 7 minutes from the hotel. Took train up from San Diego, so it was nice touch and their hotel was cheaper as I shopped around than the others nearby. The Subway sandwich around the corner from the hotel was real handy too, as I was able to grab my sandwich before I took the train back. The hotel was neat and clean, no complaints. The hotel staff was helpful in offering assistance to any little thing I needed. If the company sends me this way again, I will definitely come back to the Airtel to overnight.

Reviews.Title: “My second home!”
Reviews.Author: anne32587
Reviews.Content: Business brought me here to the Airtel numerous times this year and I'm glad our booker told me of this place.The rooms I've stayed at are large, clean. I travel extensively for business and I actually look forward to coming here when I have to make my sales calls. The clientele at the bar are local business people nearby, some big celebrity aviators and local business aviators and it is really a neat and sophisticated place to unwind. My computer froze up one day and their IT guy helped me for an hour and fixed it. I can't remember anyone doing that for me at any other place. Their employees are really dedicated workers and eager to please me to make me feel at home. I'm forever loyal here.

Reviews.Title: “Upset!”
Reviews.Author: JetCND
Reviews.Content: Honestly rooms are great clean and workers are nice...but doing online booking in cheaphotel.com or expedia.com maybe made the difference coz I booked online. Negative comments: :You have to pay extra for a request for a refrigerator if request for, refrigerator is an option not included with the deal. : You have to pay $10 per day for a parking permit to get in the parking lot. : Its an option and a different rate if you add breakfast. First time in my life a great hotel like this will pay for extra for a breakfast or not part of online booking. I dont know why people who booked give a good rate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: mrswilly036
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff (Gary and Sherry) very helpful they really went out of the way to make us feel special, food in the restaurant was great (try the calamari and flat iron steak), the room was very spacious and clean. Only suggestion would be to upgrade TV to a flat screen.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good nights sleep, splurge for jacuzzi suite if you can”
Reviews.Author: luv2gtaway_10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We were visiting family nearby and decided to take a chance at this hotel after looking at their website. We took a taxi from Burbank Airport to this hotel, which was less than 15 minutes away by cab. We asked to see if we could get an early check-in and the front office staff happily accommodated us, which was much appreciated. We had originally booked a standard room, but when we saw they had Jacuzzi suites that were on the balcony facing the runway, we decided to upgrade and we were glad we did. The spacious room was great and the huge balcony with the Jacuzzi made for a unexpected relaxing getaway. The balcony also had a nice fourtop table with umbrella and it was perfect to work on our laptops and have our morning coffee to greet the day. We had room service bring champagne and strawberries up to the room and which my husband and I savored them while soaking in the Jacuzzi – it was like date night all over again! The room was extremely comfortable and had all the amenities we need. The best things about this hotel is: Staff are exceptionally friendly - everyone was great and smiley, without being too intrusive. A special mention must be made to the Front Office Staff and bar staff who made every effort to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Thank you everyone at the hotel for making our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly fine hotel with great staff, very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: stylistmark
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly, competent and cheerful. Parking was more than ample. Room beautifully appointed, clean and quite spacious. Location of hotel was perfect, less than two miles from either the 405 San Diego Fwy and 101 Hollywood Fwy, perfect for accessing the sites we were going to see and activities to do. The breakfast buffett for $10 consisted of coffee, juice, tea, breads, nice fresh fruits, cereals and eggs diff ways and bacon. All Good by the way.The girls and guys at the front desk and even housekeepers were all wonderful as well. The surprising part was the good nights sleep even being next to the private airport. We actually found it a treat to watch the helicopters and planes take off and was entertaining. We had nothing to regret. Next time we do our Southern CA trip we will not hesitate to come back to the AirTel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and beyond!!!!”
Reviews.Author: den049
Reviews.Content: I was moved 3 times due to bed bugs in my room.. The housekeeping manager pretended that it was an ant but did confirmed by hotel manager that it was bed bugs.. I will never recommend th eproperty to anyone..Also elevator was not functioning all the time. Staff was not trained at all and housekeeping was not helpful with my children. too mny bugs in my bed....

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel and value will make us come back”
Reviews.Author: earlyriser_10
Reviews.Content: This a really good hotel. Their staff was welcoming and cheery from the every moment we were there even til when we checked out. We had requested a double room as we were with our kids and it was a nice surprise to have a room with two queen sized beds (most of where we stayed was double beds, makes it tight). We were there to visit family over Thanksgiving and also do some sightseeing. It was the perfect location as we visited family nearby and then we also went to Universal and Hollywood. We had food leftover for Thanksgiving and though our room did not have a fridge and microwave, when we asked if they had any, the staff was quick to send one up. This was a nice upgrade from a Best Western type hotel where we typically stay at and definitely safer as we were able to park our car in a secured parking lot near our room. We will definitely come back to this unique boutique hotel when we visit our family. Thank you for the free internet - made the kids happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, awesome bar, will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: kathleenonl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and is a great place to stay. Despite its location, its actually pretty quiet whether on airport side or street side. Rooms are really spacious and very clean. One of the best qualities of the hotel is the over the top friendly staff who are courteous and very accomodating. I travel quite a bit for business and many hotels and the staff here bends over backwards to make your stay very comfortable. Their bar is absolutely warm and was a perfect place for our teams to debrief after our meeting, as you can actually hear yourself talk. Decor is tropical and tastefully done. We actually ate all our meals there during our stay! The lounge is set up so there are little pockets you can dive into. We also enjoyed dining at their outdoor patio and watched the planes take off and land. With their excellent staff and food I know it will keep me and the team that I traveled here with coming back.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars--NO WAY. Sorry guys this place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: snowkhat
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel has three stars. It's pretty terrible. The decor, furniture, and electronics are extremely outdated. The fixtures are yellowed with age and the place smells of industrial cleaners admixed with mold. I fell sorry for this place. It looks like a holdover from glory days long past. It should definitely not keep it's 3 star rating. It needs a multimillion dollar overhaul. Customer service decent. Sketchy surroundings. I'd rather stay at a newly remodeled Motel 6....seriously.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,just too out of the way”
Reviews.Author: preston069
Reviews.Content: arrived on 6.10.10 for 2 nights as part of a coach trip around California.hotel was lovely,rooms very spacious and clean and area really good too(didnt hear much plane noise considering its right next to an airport and runway,slept like a log both nights) the only downfall was that if you dont have transport its quite a way into Los Angeles(not walking distance)and not much in way of shops,bars etc around hotel area. really friendly staff,very helpful if you have any queries. we would stay in this hotel again provided we had a car and wouldnt have to rely on taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Stretchycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of a tour and was surprised to find an airport right behind it because on coach tours you have to get up early and need decent sleep. However, this wasn't a problem at all and we were not disturbed by aircraft noise. Our group was served champagne and punch on arrival. The rooms are lovely and very comfortable; only one odd thing - no electricity for hairdryer or coffee maker on one morning, but the lights worked fine. The staff were very friendly and also extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Staff has masters degree in nice, food fantastic, will return when in CA”
Reviews.Author: frenchbaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting our niece attending a local university CSUN and she told us to stay at this hotel because it was near her school and we also wanted to sight seeing at Universal before she went back to school. We were very happy with the big smiles and happy to have you as guest approach/attitude that we had not experienced in many big hotels. By first day everyone knew our name and we very much felt like VIP yet it was our first day of visit. The food at restaurante was delicious and hearty. We loved their seafood chowder - delicious! Hotel was much cheaper than the other chain competition. The location was very centrale to our needs and will recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at this hotel is a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: evie084
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while we were in town for a family event. The location was great and just a short drive from Burbank Airport. The lobby was impressive, as was all the amenities.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant was really nice and had a great breakfast buffet. The rooms were huge and the bed and pillows were the most comfortable we've ever had in a hotel! I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to the L.A. area.

Reviews.Title: “Good option close to Universal & Hollywood area”
Reviews.Author: SSB79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Airtel Plaza with my wife for 3 nights recently while visiting LA. We had booked through Priceline and after I saw that we got this hotel, I was a bit worried because it is right next to the airport. Also, when I found out that they charged $10 per night for parking, I was a bit anxious as to whether I'd get nickel and dimed for everything else. However, my worries turned out to be misplaced. The hotel was quite nice and quiet. The room included all the standard amenities like a hair dryer, iron and board, coffee maker and free internet access. The hotel has a to-go cafe bar and a nice restaurant with a huge patio deck. I only noticed the airplanes while having breakfast on this patio deck, otherwise the place was pretty quiet. We had to request extra creamers/sugar and some toothpaste and housekeeping was prompt in bringing these by. We also were quite pleased with the quick access (in LA, quick is a relative term) to Universal and the Hollywood area. All in all, I was quite happy with the hotel for the price I paid (even including the $10/night parking).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: lizcha
Reviews.Content: We flew into Van Nuys and stayed at the Airtel for 3 nights. We had requested ahead of time a room facing the runway, but on arrival, none were available. The front desk bent over backwards to make that right, putting us into an awesome 2 room suite instead. The following day, we had all kinds of trouble with a rental car company who were supposed to be dropping a car off for us. Once again, the staff at the hotel were very helpful. Breakfast (included with our room) was just OK...a minimalist buffet. The restaurant was decent for dinner. One note of caution: rooms facing the runway can be noisy. It's a busy airport, with lots of light aircraft and jets taking off. We're aviation people, so it was not a problem, but if you want a quiet, sleep-inducing stay, I'd suggest picking a room away from the runways.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to CSUN, warm welcomes , highly recommend for value”
Reviews.Author: movieguy_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel based on the favorable reviews and we all were satisfied. Was in the Valley to check out CSUN for our son and also do some sightseeing to Getty Center and Universal, which were only 15 minutes away and CSUN was less than 10 minutes away. The lobby was warm and the restaurant and bar were very modern and found it to be calming escapes. Rooms were clean and spacious, as were the bathroom. We dislike small hotel rooms where you have to walk sideways between the bed and tv but this one was generous, as my wife and I are large people. Bathroom was big and tip for all is the vanity/sink is separate from toilet/shower. The bell desk and front desk were very welcoming. There was a Circle K market one block away, as was the Subway and Thai restaurant. Also, there's a Food for Less one block away too. We will be coming back here for sure when we visit our son at CSUN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and eager to please employees, free internet, tons of pluses”
Reviews.Author: mrrealest8
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for a G.H. Fan convention weekend and had a marvelous time. The hotel was very busy during the convention and even with all the busy events happening while we were there for several days, the staff were all very helpful without the appearance of being stressed out and hurried. I am a tough critic being from Jersey and I was impressed! They had the best club sandwich I ever had and it was so good I wanted it for breakfast and though it was 9am they said they can cook up whatever I wanted, which was the right approach. My wife lost her autographs from the stars and when we told the banquet man of our problem, they all scurried around immediately and saved the day and found it. We would definitely stay here again next year when we return to the Valley. It's all about the service, service, service and this place did it for me.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent”
Reviews.Author: swaranusa
Reviews.Content: I had a good time here. There was an airport nearby so very convenient. The parking was paid which was a drawback but the rest was nice. They had decent rooms. Not too far from places to hang out. It was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, definitely coming back in an LA minute”
Reviews.Author: mysterydude99
Reviews.Content: The price is right, the room is roomy and the food is darn good and best of all, the peoples treat ya like somethin' special. I've been here the last 3 visits to LA and I felt that I needed to give this independent some credit, so I thought I'd write and let the people out there know if you need a really pretty decent place to overnight, you won't go wrong here. I was here with my girlfriend and if you hapen to be here on a Friday night, there Clipper Bar is like a dance club with beautiful people having tons of fun. The good thing about it, the cover is free for the hotel guests which was a plus for us. We danced til 1am and had a blast, so for those seeking some fun, you got it here too. We checked in the jacuzzi suite they had on the site and it was pretty cool - real different and a treat. Definitely returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Solid satisfying stay, would stay again, no”
Reviews.Author: whisky6_10
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at another hotel (marriott) but I found that the Airtel had better rates as well as more raves than complaints (are Priceline always unhappy, so I sorta ignored them) so I booked it independently. It proved to be a great choice from the time of arrival to departure. The front desk agent noticed that it happened to be my bday that day, so he upgraded me to a suite, which totally caught me by surprise. The front desk agents were extremely cordial and helpful and even took me to the local CVS since I needed a battery for my camera. Had a great supper at their restaurant. They had complimentary coffee at lobby which I needed to catch my early 7am flight to LAX. Really good hotel, I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expecations, good choice if going to Universal on a budget”
Reviews.Author: kaylac_10
Reviews.Content: After staying at several 4 star hotels in our family trip, the Airtel really caught us by surprise. Was here for 3 nights and had a great time with my family. Stayed in a suite with our kids, asked for a room with a fridge and microwave and they accomodated us. The pool area was great, as we got to watch these cool jets and helicopters take off, so the kids and us loved it. We were concerned with proximity since right on the private Airport, but surprisingly, the stay was quiet, even in the rooms. In the 3 hotels we stayed at in our journeys, this one was our favorite. The staff really is what we figured made the difference, and the other reviews that I read on thishotel were pretty accurate. ITheir Universal Package with hotel and discount tixkets were cheaper than any of the hotels we shopped around that were closer to Universsal. For those that want a tip, I suggest taking the complimentary hotel shuttle to the Metro less than a mile away and take the Metro to Uiversal, so for about $1.25 each and 20 minutes later, we were at the bottom of Universal Shuttle stop. The hotel sold us the Universal Tickets at a discount, which helped alot. We really enjoyed our stay and will recommend to others visiting LA for sure.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, happy with choice”
Reviews.Author: ktkphx
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were in a tour of LA with others and we voted this was the nicest of the places we ended up staying, hands down! The employees were quick and eager to help and made sure we were comfy during brief stay. As a tip to other travelers, if you crave excellent Thai food, there is a restaurant called Kinnara that is less than a mile from hotel that wasnot a hole in the wall, small but elegant actually, the best Thai food we ever encountered and great food presentation. The fried catfish is to die for! There's even a Japanese S"ushi place open til 1am that we found terrific. Wish they were all near our home. We will be returning soonto Airtel, Cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: grant81
Reviews.Content: Not knowing the Valley very well, we chose the Airtel for its value and recommend from friends we were visiting nearby and even though its not a chain hotel, we didnt know what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room came with breakfast and appreciated the free wifi. Friendly staff and enjoyed dining at their lovely restaurant. We sat outside and enjoyed ourselves in comfy setting (had two meals there and thought food was delicious and big helpings - loved the braised shortribs and kids enjoyed the spaghetti bolognese). Even though room did not come with refrigerator and microwave, you can rent one for $5 a day, which was fine with us to put leftovers in. Good hotel and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with accomodation, good hotel near CSUN”
Reviews.Author: cynfish
Reviews.Content: Was here for CSUN graduation for my niece and the airtel was very handy location, no more than four miles. Very nice employees and service. Stayed here for 3 days and even though i was a solo traveler, the employees made me feel like home. they have lots of great salads and its nice to have half portions, since i am a light eater when traveling on the road. i actually invited my family to eat at the restaurant and though they had never been at the Airtel, even though they live so close, they loved the food and wondered why they never even thought of coming to the hotel to the eat. They will be returning and so will I next time I am in the area to visit them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay, I'm a huge Fan!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michaelwine
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at the Airtel and I gotta tell you, I am becoming a loyal fan. It's nice to stay somewhere where they all recognize you, feels like a second home. Everyone I was in contact with, from bellman to waiters and front desk was prompt, friendly and professional. Room was comfy, roomy and spotless. Free internet and big bathroom a plus. Next time I am in town, I will treat my wife to try out one of their outdoor jacuzzi suites. This business traveler will be back to this hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian5900
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the tripadvisor review. However, I couldn't say that I was happy with the decision. Here are some pros and cons about the hotel: Pros: large and spacious room; good exhaust system in the bathroom; breakfast included; free internet. Cons: no central control for the AC/heater unit so it was always too hot/cold; some of the rooms have windows that are facing each other so you can see the patrons on the other side; so so breakfast; no refrigerator/microwave; somewhat dated room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous FInd”
Reviews.Author: judianna
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience staying at the Airtel Plaza Hotel. Everyone that works there is incredibly nice and personable. I had four girls total staying, and that one room was more than large enough for all of us to have plenty of space. The rooms were immaculately cleaned every day. The restaurant on-site was fabulous! I have zero complaints about the hotel, everything was perfect and for the price, it is almost ridiculous. I'm coming back to the area in a couple months and already have the hotel booked :) And the staff is as good as it gets anywhere. Loved them.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight was excellent”
Reviews.Author: capecod170
Reviews.Content: Unexpected 2 night business trip stay was excellent, Nice bar area, friendly staff and most important a good nights rest I found hotel to be a great place to conduct business while traveling corporate air, quick cab to client meeting in Burbank Would stay again during business

Reviews.Title: “Greatly missed the mark on value & expectations”
Reviews.Author: COboy0003
Reviews.Content: I had reserved one of their King spa Terrace rooms (oversized room w/spa on oversized balacony) and walked into a average room with a jaquizzi in the corner of the room. Went back top front desk and explained the oversite. Was told the room was correct, but provided keys to another room. The new room met the description of what I booked on-line, but the carpet was very stained (hotel received a recent renovation?), smelled of deodorizer (type used to remove cigarette smoke, sheets were stained-very thin/old). Bathroom tile is old-grout stained, needs a thorough cleaning. Would not stay here again under any circumstances!

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: rolinbud
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at this hotel and I was having trouble with their internet access. They did not like the way I complained at the front desk. So long story short I was actually escorted back to my room by the local tough for simple complaining about the bad internet access. To sum up. if you complain about anything, they will have the local tough embarass you. I stay in a different hotel ever week and this was a first.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Staff, Couldn't Have Had A Better Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JBone79
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is what sets it apart. They cater to every need, and are unbelievably friendly. The room (basic room) was enormous and had an excellent view of Van Nuys Airport and the surrounding mountains. Amenities are top notch, and the free breakfast is killer. Only complaint I had was the fee for parking- it cost $10/day and requires you to scan a card to enter and exit. It's understandable, but unnecessary in my opinion. Small price to pay for an awesome staff and awesome room. I was there on business, so I can't speak on the value of the room, but I highly recommend for anyone planning a trip to the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderfan
Reviews.Content: stayed for four nights,housekeeping is top notch, rooms are huge, very friendly staff. Hot tub can sit 15-20 people which is usually very uncommon .they have two extra hot tubs in building. The airport theme is pretty cool. Even the toilets flush like airplane toilets. They charge $10/night for parking tho

Reviews.Title: “Love staying here”
Reviews.Author: owlcoast
Reviews.Content: Love staying here. Suites are roomy - bigger than at DoubleTree. And with pullout couch in living room, kids can stay in one room while parents stay in another. They actually have real cribs for young kids - as opposed to Pak N Play - which means parents can wheel kids from one room to another if needed. Only other hotel I've seen with real cribs is Four Seasons. Our kids like seeing the airplanes takeoff and land - and so do I!

Reviews.Title: “Airtel-Average”
Reviews.Author: MeganS14
Reviews.Content: I am from small town USA so I was not used to some of the charges that the hotel had. Just to park the car in the lot was charged by the day. My favorite part of the stay was the BED! So comfy:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireRammie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Airtel Plaza twice. The first time being September 2008. On returning this year we found the hotel had been upgraded with the addition of a pool & restaurant. Both these added to an already first class hotel. The food and service in the restaurant was first class and along with the hotel can be thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff were OUTSTANDING - both professional and personal”
Reviews.Author: tuitionforkids
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be disappointed in this hotel because it was not a standard "brand" hotel where I have stayed on other trips to Los Angeles. Boy, was I happy! Everyone from the front office staff who remembered my name every day when I returned to the hotel from meetings to the housekeeping staff who were always on their toes and helpful with anything I would ask them for. What a pleasure to travel to the Airtel! I will be back again when business brings me to the San Fernando Valley, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, my first choice the next time I'm in LA”
Reviews.Author: Family_Guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while on vacation. We got a great deal on Priceline and our room was very nice. compared to other hotels in the area, the rooms (at least ours) are large and comfy. We chose to stay in this area while doing hollywood vacation stuff and we were glad we did. you just get more value here then the hollywood area hotel we stayed at first. They charge 10 bucks for parking at the Airtel which is less then many hotels but I thought this was silly since they have so much parking avalible. They even rope off sections of the parking lot so you are forced to pay to park in the back - I mean come on! I should however give this hotel thumbs up for free internet! Paid parking aside, this is a great hotel, the other reviews on this site are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Precious14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends for the holidays. It was my first time here and I didn't know the hotel so I asked the front desk agent to help us in choosing a room. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. The room was very spacious and had a great view of the courtyard. What I like best was that the vanity was located separate from the shower which was great for us. Overall great customer service and what a deal we got on the rooms. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYTRAVELLERS55_9
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel for short stay,clean,nice restaurant, nice small pool. Small private airport next door, creates a lot of noise. Good small diner just round corner, sit in or take away, good quality, large portions, very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visiting CSUN”
Reviews.Author: LaurieASanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights to visit college son at CSUN and attend his performances. Staff was very nice and helpful, Traveled with my 16 year old son and his friend. The room was decent size for us. We requested a room with a view of the airport and runway and were very happy with it although the beds are a little hard. The windows open so we could get fresh air or close the window and not hear almost anything from the planes. We didn't visit the restaurant so I don't know how the food there is. I did pick up coffee and pastries on our last morning there. The caramel macchiato at the little place in the lobby was awesome! Best coffee I've had! When I asked at the front desk about the 12 o'clock check out time and that I was trying to get the boys moving but we might be a few minutes late, they responded that it was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Clean”
Reviews.Author: Nathug_7
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this Hotel, October 30- November 3, 2009. The hotel is very clean, breakfast is great and cost is very reasonable. We booked through Travelocity and got free parking and breakfast. I highly recomend this hotel. Noise from airport only when windows are open. Good Value.. have a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and On-Site Amenities Made This a Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: chicsun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days, 7/16-7/20...overall, a lovely experience. Despite the hotel being a bit remote from attractions, my girlfriend and I enjoyed the conveniences of this hotel. Being able to grab something quick or linger over breakfast on the outdoor patio was great, we enjoyed a Steak/Buffet Fri. evening, excellent. Customer service, ranging from bar, restaurant and front desk were efficient and friendly. A "thumbs up" to Kurt, our bartender. Yes, there is noise from the plane landings, but this decreased into the night. Room was clean and met all expectations. Had a car rental for part of the time, but found the hotel shuttle and Flyaway service reliable. Oh, the pool was fine, as well, we were in 100 degree heat, it was nice to cool off. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly, helpful staff, rooms were also nice”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Very helpful in giving directions. Hotel is located right next to the Van Nuys Airport, the planes are noisy when outside by the pool, but sound is muffled in the rooms. The rooms are very nice and fairly large. Free wireless internet, also free ethernet cable. Comfortable beds, large sink/counter (which is outside the bathroom w/toilet and shower. The shower head wasn't too great - weird settings, not much water pressure. Not many restaurants or places to see within walking distance. You definitely need a car, but parking is $9.00/day. There are nicer neighborhoods in the Valley but the hotel and staff are very nice. Alot of meeting rooms and big conference center

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and free internet a surprise bonus.”
Reviews.Author: tinapai18
